title: Represent and analyze - block-spring U and K vs t

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is placed on a horizontal surface with negligible friction and attached to one end of an ideal spring with a spring constant <math alttext="lowercase k sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, with the other end of the spring attached to a wall, as shown in the figure. The block oscillates with an angular frequency <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and amplitude <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the block is at its equilibrium position. Which of the following pairs of equations represent the spring’s potential energy <math alttext="U of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>U</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and the block’s kinetic energy <math alttext="uppercase K of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>K</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> as functions of time while the block is oscillating?

choices.label: <math alttext="U of t equals, one half lowercase k sub 0, end sub, times D times the sine of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>D</mi><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="uppercase K of t equals, one half m sub 0, end sub, times D times omega sub 0, end sub, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>K</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>D</mi><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="U of t equals, one half lowercase k sub 0, end sub, times D times the cosine of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>D</mi><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="uppercase K of t equals, one half m sub 0, end sub, times D times omega sub 0, end sub, times the sine of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>K</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>D</mi><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="U of t equals, one half lowercase k sub 0, end sub, times D squared, times the sine squared of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>U</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="uppercase K of t equals, one half m sub 0, end sub, times D squared, times omega sub 0, end sub, squared, times the cosine squared of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>K</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>cos</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="U of t equals, one half lowercase k sub 0, end sub, times D squared, times the cosine squared of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>cos</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="uppercase K of t equals, one half m sub 0, end sub, times D squared, times omega sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine squared of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>K</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="U of t equals, one half lowercase k sub 0, end sub, times D squared, times the sine squared of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>U</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="uppercase K of t equals, one half m sub 0, end sub, times D squared, times omega sub 0, end sub, squared, times the cosine squared of, open parenthesis, omega sub 0, end sub, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>K</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>cos</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
